Class ClientInstance

  • java.lang.Object
    • ClientInstance

  • public class ClientInstance
extends java.lang.Object

    This class defines a Client Instance that can

    • Build connections with a server.
    • Accept user input and handle sending to the server.
    • Handle responses from the server.

    There are two threads in a ClientInstance:

    • ClientInstance.IncomingHandler handles incoming messages
    • ClientInstance.OutgoingHandler handles outgoing messages
    They works concurrently.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private static class  ClientInstance.IncomingHandler
      IncomingHandler handles receiving and printing out messages from others.
      private static class  ClientInstance.OutgoingHandler
      OutgoingHandler handles sending message to the server.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ClientInstance

        public ClientInstance(java.lang.String serverIP,
                      int port)

        Creates a new instance of ClientInstance.

        A ClientInstance has two threads:
        1. ClientInstance.IncomingHandler handles receiving messages.
        2. ClientInstance.OutgoingHandler handles sending messages
        Parameters:
        serverIP - the IP Address of the server
        port - the port number of the server

    • Method Detail

      • close

        private static void close()

        Cuts off the connection with server, close the streams and program exits.

        close() will be called in three cases:
        1. Client wants to disconnect.
        2. Connection is lost or Server is shut down.
        3. Client is kicked out of the chat room by Administrator.

        Reasons for why the Client program is going to exit will be printed out.

      • encode

        private static java.lang.String encode(java.lang.String str)

        Uses XOR Cipher to encode or decode a message.

        Since x ^ y ^ y = x (^ is XOR operation), XOR can be used as a cipher.

        When sending or receiving a message from each other, Server and Client will encode or decode it first to make sure that even if some people can get the message in some illegal ways, the message will just be some messy codes to them because of the lack of key to decode them.

        Since that for XOR Cipher, the process of encryption and decryption are exactly the same, we simply use encode(String) for both encoding and decoding.

        Parameters:
        str - the original message in encryption or the encoded message in decryption.
        Returns:
        the original message in decryption or the encoded message in encryption.
